text: The 1966 Italian Athletics Championships was the 56th edition of the Italian Athletics Championships and were held in Florence (track & field events). ==Champions== ===Men=== {| class="wikitable" width=80% style="font-size:90%; text-align:left;" |- !Event !!Athlete !!Performance |- |100 metres|| Pasquale Giannattasio ||align=center|10.5 |- |200 metres|| Sergio Ottolina ||align=center|21.1 |- |400 metres|| Sergio Bello ||align=center|47.3 |- |800 metres|| Gianfranco Carabelli ||align=center|1:52.5 |- |1500 metres|| Francesco Arese ||align=center|3:54.0 |- |5000 metres|| Renzo Finelli ||align=center|14:16.2 |- |10,000 metres|| Antonio Ambu ||align=center|30:12.4 |- |110 metres hurdles|| Eddy Ottoz ||align=center|14.0 |- |400 metres hurdles|| Roberto Frinolli ||align=center|50.7 |- |3000 metres steeplechase|| Massimo Begnis ||align=center|9:05.2 |- |High jump|| Erminio Azzaro ||align=center|2.08 |- |Pole vault|| Renato Dionisi ||align=center|4.80 |- |Long jump|| Pierluigi Gatti ||align=center|7.39 |- |Triple jump|| Giuseppe Gentile ||align=center|15.43 |- |Shot put|| Michele Sorrenti ||align=center|17.13 |- |Discus throw|| Silvano Simeon ||align=center|54.66 |- |Hammer throw|| Walter Bernardini ||align=center|58.09 |- |Javelin throw|| Vanni Rodeghiero ||align=center|76.78* |- |Decathlon|| Sergio Rossetti ||align=center|6980 |- |Half Marathon|| Antonio Ambu ||align=center|1:02:19# |- |Marathon|| Antonio Ambu ||align=center|02:22:25 |- |10,000 metres track walk|| Abdon Pamich ||align=center|44:46.4 |- |20 km road walk|| Abdon Pamich ||align=center|01:31:29 |- |50 km road walk|| Abdon Pamich ||align=center|04:18:03 |- |Cross country (long course)|| Antonio Ambu ||align=center| |} ===Women=== {| class="wikitable" width=80% style="font- size:90%;
